attributes.action: Review digital consumer law to include trading of digital games.
attributes.additional_details: Our consumer rights act was drafted in 2015 offering consumers more protection when buying digital goods. However the percentage of games bought digitally since then has increased massively and now accounts for over 80% of all game sales.
attributes.background: Review fair practice around consumers being able to buy and sell digital copies of games.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do to change the law on trading of digital games. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
